basics.name: Md. Masud Rana
basics.label: Bioinformatics Researcher
basics.summary: A bioinformatics researcher with expertise in toxicogenomics, statistical modeling, and machine learning applied to complex biological datasets.

work.name: National Genomics Data Center, Beijing Institute of Genomics, CAS & CNCB
work.summary: Conducted research on biomarkers of drug-induced toxicity, developed statistical models, and implemented bioinformatics software tools.
highlights: Developed 'ToxAssay' for biomarker discovery in toxicogenomics.
Created 'ALVA' for prioritizing compound targets using gene expression data.
Implemented robust stacking ensemble learning (RSEL) for predicting liver toxicity endpoints.

work.name: Freelance Data Scientist
work.summary: Conducted data analysis and modeling for diverse clients in Sydney, Australia.

work.name: Secondary Education Quality and Access Enhancement Project
work.summary: Provided mathematics education under a World Bank-supported initiative.

education.institution: Beijing Institute of Genomics, Chinese Academy of Sciences

awards.title: CAS-TWAS Presidentâ€™s Fellowship Programme for Doctoral Candidates
awards.summary: Awarded for exceptional academic performance and research contributions.

awards.title: Third Place in Poster Presentation Competition
awards.awarder: International Conference on Biological Sciences, University of Rajshahi
awards.summary: Recognized for a presentation on toxicogenomic biomarkers.

awards.title: First Place in Statistical Computing Competition
awards.awarder: Department of Statistics, University of Rajshahi
awards.summary: Won a departmental competition for excellence in computational statistics using C++.

publications.name: ToxAssay: A hierarchical model-driven tool for advanced toxicogenomics biomarker discovery
publications.summary: Developed a software tool for biomarker discovery in toxicogenomics, revealing pathways and mechanisms.

publications.name: Prioritizing compound targets by perturbed gene expression using ALVA
publications.summary: Proposed a method for refining biomarkers in carcinogenesis through gene expression analysis.

publications.name: Robust co-clustering for toxicogenomics biomarker discovery
publications.summary: Introduced a co-clustering model to identify regulatory doses of chemical compounds.

references.name: Dr. Fan Liu
references.reference: Full Professor at Naif Arab University for Security Sciences, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

references.name: Dr. Zhang Zhang
references.reference: Professor & Associate Director, National Genomics Data Center, Chinese Academy of Sciences

references.name: Dr. Md. Nurul Haque Mollah
references.reference: Professor, Department of Statistics, University of Rajshahi, Bangladesh

projects.name: ToxAssay
projects.summary: A software tool for automating toxicogenomics data analysis and biomarker discovery.
highlights: Revealed adverse outcome pathways for drug-induced toxicity.
Identified core genes for glutathione depletion.

projects.name: ALVA
projects.summary: An algorithm to prioritize compound targets through gene expression perturbations.
highlights: Contributed to targeted therapies for hepatotoxicity and cancer.
